topic: Deep dive: _osx_support standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _osx_support standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: _osx_support Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: An in-depth exploration of the _osx_support module, a new addition to the standard library in Python 3.12 that provides platform-specific functionality for macOS.
key_points: _osx_support is a standard library module exclusive to Python 3.12 and above.
It provides access to APIs specific to macOS, which are not available on other platforms.
The main purpose of _osx_support is to simplify the development of macOS-specific applications using Python.
To utilize this module, you must ensure your Python version is 3.12 or higher and that you're running the code on a macOS system.
version_notes: Previously, macOS-specific APIs could be accessed through third-party libraries such as AppKit or Carbon.
However, the introduction of _osx_support simplifies development and reduces dependencies on external packages.
caveats: _osx_support is not available on platforms other than macOS.
While this module offers macOS-specific functionality, keep in mind that for broader compatibility, you may still need to rely on other libraries or frameworks.
As with any platform-specific code, ensure your applications are thoroughly tested across various versions of macOS.
